text: Djedi was an Egyptian prince who lived during Fourth Dynasty of Egypt. He was a son of Prince Rahotep and Nofret, grandson of pharaoh Sneferu and nephew of pharaoh Khufu. He had two brothers and three sisters.W. M. Flinders Petrie: Medum, London 1892, plate XV (online: ) He is depicted in the tomb chapels of his parents and bears there the title "King's Acquaintance". In an ancient Egyptian tale, "Khufu and the Magicians", mention is made of a magician called Djedi or Dedi, and it is possible that this mythical person was inspired by the real prince Djedi, Khufu's nephew.Tales of Magic in Ancient Egypt == See also == * Westcar Papyrus == References == Category:Princes of the Fourth Dynasty of Egypt
title: Prince Djedi
